moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Qc2 d5 4. Nf3 Bg7: There isn't any special theme to until this situation. I have main idea to keep castling to both side open as long as possible.
moves.11. h4: Now I can try something sharp because 0-0-0 is possible
moves.11... e5 12. Bg5: Just looking shortly black queen, hoping that pawn comes f6 and black bishop is then not so powerfull
moves.12... f6 13. Be3: there is now plenty of variations to play against exd4
moves.13... Nf8: there is no hurry for castling :)... sharp play continues
moves.14. h5 Be6: black don't mind my h pawn... go go
moves.15. h6 Bh8: now black King has no save places at all and Bishop...he is deep deep deep
moves.16. dxe5: breaking center her majestic will be without cover after some moves
moves.16... fxe5 17. Nc5: I want eliminate black bishop, because it is too powerful defence man for king and with threat of b7 both white knights are active
moves.17... Qe7 18. Ng5 Bf7 19. Nxf7 Qxf7: Now there is black king like sitting duck
moves.20. a4: this is nice little move. I'm gonna play a5 and then Bc4, black has to play a5, which will cost b7 pawn.
moves.20... a5 21. Nxb7 Qxb7 22. Qb3+: now, Black playing Qf7 will get endgame with difficulties, but Ne6 is ruining move, I think
moves.22... Ne6 23. Bc4 Kf7: Now black king will be "in lights"
moves.24. Qxb6 Qxb6 25. Bxb6 Reb8 26. Bc5: this situation I have seen several moves before and I have calculated 2 black choice...
moves.27. O-O-O: black have to choose now..Rb8 or Rb7...If Rb8 these were the moves what I planned: 27...Rb8 28.Rd7+ Ke8 29. Bxe6 Rb1+ 30. Kc2 Rxh1 31. Rg7!! Kd8 32.Bd6 ...White wins, I think
moves.27... Rb7 28. Rd6 Re8: Knight is now binned forever, lets do same to Bishop !
moves.29. Rh3 Bf6 30. Rf3: And now what moves black has anymore left :) ?
moves.30... Rc7 31. g4 g5 32. Rf5: and what moves he has now  :)  ?
moves.32... Rcc8 33. Be3: well here we are...nice work I think :)
